marketNews.title: US-RI Agrees on Trade Framework
marketNews.content:
The US White House announced on Tuesday (22/7) local time the framework for trade negotiation agreement with Indonesia. Here are the main points from this agreement:

1. Indonesia will eliminate tariffs on approximately 99% of products originating from the US, covering industrial, food, and agricultural products. Meanwhile, tariffs for goods originating from Indonesia will decrease from 32% to 19%. The White House stated that the US can identify certain commodities that are neither naturally available nor domestically produced in the US for further tariff reduction.
2. Indonesia will eliminate non-tariff barriers, such as exempting US companies and goods from TKDN requirements, accepting vehicles made according to US federal safety and emission standards, removing import restrictions and licensing requirements for remanufactured US goods or spare parts, and eliminating pre-shipment inspections and verification for US exports.
3. Indonesian companies will sign commercial agreements with US companies, including: 1) aircraft imports valued at 3.2 billion US dollars; 2) imports of agricultural products, including soybeans, soybean meal, wheat, and cotton with an estimated total value of 4.5 billion US dollars; and 3) imports of energy products, including LPG, crude oil, and gasoline, with an estimated total value of 15 billion US dollars.
4. Indonesia will cancel the plan to impose tariffs on internet data flows and agree to support the extension of the WTO e-commerce tariff moratorium.
5. Indonesia agreed to remove export restrictions on industrial commodities, including critical minerals.
6. The US and Indonesia will negotiate rules of origin to ensure the benefits of this agreement are felt by the US and Indonesia, and not by third-party countries.
7. Indonesia agreed to join the Global Forum on Steel Excess Capacity and take action to address global overcapacity in the steel sector.
The White House stated that in the coming weeks, the US and Indonesia will still negotiate and finalize the trade agreement before it comes into effect.

Key Takeaway
Overall, we assess that the main points announced above are relatively in line with previous indications, so this announcement does not have a significant impact on market movements. However, we highlight the point regarding the removal of export restrictions on industrial commodities, which still requires more detailed information to assess its impact.

In addition, we see that with the trade agreement nearly finalized, the government can return its focus to domestic programs, including the purchasing power issue, which we consider to be the main factor monitored by investors.

marketNews.title: China launches inspections to halt excessive coal production
marketNews.content: [Bloomberg](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2025-07-22/china-launches-inspections-to-halt-excessive-coal-production) reported that the Chinese government warned it would close coal mines proven to be producing above the permitted levels. These inspections will run until August 15, 2025, with companies found producing more than 110% of their determined capacity during 1H25 facing sanctions, including production suspension. China's national energy agency is conducting month-long inspections across 8 provinces and regions - which altogether contribute to 90% of China's total coal production - as part of a crackdown on over-mining deemed to be distorting the market.

marketNews.title: Head of BPOM says TNI will form a special unit to produce medicine from military pharmaceutical laboratories
marketNews.content: The Head of the Food and Drug Supervisory Agency, Taruna Ikrar, stated that the pharmaceutical laboratory owned by the Indonesian National Armed Forces (TNI) will produce and distribute medicine to the general public through the Koperasi Desa Merah Putih. The Minister of Defense, Sjafrie Sjamsoeddin, mentioned that this step is taken to suppress drug prices. Sjafrie also said that mass production will begin in October 2025 and medicines will be distributed to villages across Indonesia at a price 50% below retail price. On the other hand, [Reuters](https://www.reuters.com/business/healthcare-pharmaceuticals/indonesian-militarys-new-pharma-role-sparks-fears-expanded-powers-2025-07-23/) reported that human rights groups assess this move as illegal because it places active military officials in civilian business positions.

marketNews.title: GIIAS 2025 Automotive Exhibition
marketNews.content: The Gaikindo Indonesia International Auto Show (GIIAS) 2025 automotive exhibition will be held this week from July 24 to August 3, 2025, at the Indonesia Convention Exhibition, BSD City. [Kompas](https://otomotif.kompas.com/read/2025/07/21/135754815/catat-jadwal-giias-2025-yang-digelar-pekan-ini) reported that as of April 2025, more than 55 automotive brands have confirmed their participation in GIIAS 2025 (vs. [GIIAS 2024](https://www.gaikindo.or.id/pameran-otomotif-giias-2024-makin-dekat-perhatikan-cara-membeli-tiket/#:~:text=GIIAS%202024%C2%A0Tangerang%2C%20akan%20diikuti%20oleh%2055%20merek%20kendaraan%20bermotor.): 55 brands).

marketNews.title: US President Trump announces tariff deal with Japan; auto stocks surge
marketNews.content: US President Donald Trump announced that the US and Japan have reached a trade agreement, which includes a reduction in import tariffs for goods originating from Japan. The Japanese automotive sector - which accounts for more than a quarter of Japan's exports to the US - will see tariffs cut from 27.5% to 15%. Furthermore, import tariffs for other goods originating from Japan as of August 1, 2025, will also be cut from 25% to 15%. Following this announcement, the benchmark Nikkei stock index surged about +3.5% on Wednesday (23/7) to its highest level in the last year, driven by gains in automotive stocks.

marketNews.title: Indonesia plans $8 billion refinery contracts with US firm amid tariffs deal
marketNews.content: [Reuters](https://www.reuters.com/business/energy/indonesia-plans-8-billion-refineries-contract-with-us-firm-amid-tariffs-deal-2025-07-22/) reported that Danantara plans to sign an engineering, procurement, and construction contract worth 8 billion US dollars with the US construction company, KBR Inc. (NYSE: KBR), to build 17 modular refineries. The contract is part of the trade and tariff negotiations agreed upon by Indonesia and the US last week. Danantara and KBR Inc. have not yet commented on this news.

marketNews.title: Government to finalize AI roadmap in August 2025 to attract foreign investment
marketNews.content: Deputy Minister of Communication and Digital, Nezar Patria, told [Reuters](https://www.reuters.com/business/media-telecom/indonesia-targets-foreign-investment-with-new-ai-roadmap-official-says-2025-07-22/) that the government will finalize the AI roadmap in August 2025, which will be the first national strategic document related to AI after the government released AI ethics guidelines in 2023. This step aims to build an AI ecosystem in Indonesia to attract foreign investment, following Malaysia's efforts to establish itself as a center for AI development in Southeast Asia.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia: Broad Money (M2) in June 2025 grew by 6.5% YoY to IDR 9,597.7 Trillion
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia noted that the economy's liquidity or broad money (M2) in June 2025 grew by +6.5% YoY to 9,597.7 trillion rupiah (vs. May 2025: +4.9% YoY). This development was driven by the growth of narrow money (M1) by +8% YoY and quasi money by +4.7% YoY.

tickerNews.title: CDIA Directors Buy Shares, 2Q25 Financial Statements to be Audited
tickerNews.content: CDIA: Two directors of Chandra Daya Investasi, Fransiskus Ruly Aryawan and Jonathan Kandinata, each purchased 5 million CDIA shares at an average price of 800 rupiah per share on July 17, 2025. The total transaction value for both reached approximately 8 billion rupiah. Following these transactions, the direct share ownership of Fransiskus Ruly Aryawan and Jonathan Kandinata in CDIA increased from none to 0.004% respectively. Additionally, CDIA stated that the company will conduct an audit for the 2Q25 financial statements.

tickerNews.title: HMSP Sales Volume Decline Moderates in 2Q25, Market Share Increases to Highest Since 2019
tickerNews.content: HMSP: Philip Morris International noted that the sales volume of Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna cigarettes decreased by -3.7% YoY in 2Q25 (vs. 2Q24: -6.4% YoY, 1Q25: +0.6% YoY). This result caused the sales volume for 1H25 to drop by -1.5% YoY (vs. 1H24: -1.5% YoY), marking a decline trend in the first semester for 3 consecutive years. The realization was still better than the industry sales which fell -7% YoY in 2Q25 (vs. 2Q24: -10% YoY, 1Q25: +2.6% YoY) and -4.3% YoY during 1H25 (vs. 1H24: -6.6% YoY). Consequently, HMSP's market share rose to approximately 31% in 2Q25 and during 1H25 - both marking the highest level since 2019 - up from 26.8% in 1Q25, which was the lowest level since at least 1Q14. Based on product segmentation, HMSP cigarette sales decreased by -2% YoY during 1H25, while IQOS sales volume rose by +34% YoY.

tickerNews.title: ARNA Net Profit in 2Q25 rises slightly YoY, Revenue grows 24% YoY, Gross Profit Margin decreases due to higher manufacturing and raw material costs
tickerNews.content: ARNA: Arwana Citramulia recorded a net profit of 99 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (+0.8% YoY, -6% QoQ). This result brought the net profit for 1H25 to 204 billion rupiah (+0.5% YoY), equivalent to approximately 44% of management's 2025 guidance. Revenue grew +24% YoY and +6% QoQ in 2Q25 (vs. 2Q24: +4% YoY, 1Q25: +9% YoY), bringing 1H25 revenue to 1.4 trillion rupiah (+17% YoY). However, the gross profit margin in 2Q25 dropped to 29.6% (vs. 2Q24: 32.9%, 1Q25: 31.9%) due to an increase in manufacturing costs (+29% YoY) and raw material costs (+28% YoY) alongside the weakening rupiah exchange rate and rising gas prices.

tickerNews.title: IPCC Cargo Handling Performance in 1H25
tickerNews.content: IPCC: Indonesia Kendaraan Terminal recorded handling of completely built-up (CBU) imported car cargo of 423,952 units during 1H25 (+7.8% YoY), handling of truck or bus cargo of 94,782 units (+23% YoY), and handling of heavy equipment of 15,870 units (+32.7% YoY). Shipping calls recorded 1,571 calls during 1H25 (+13.9% YoY).

tickerNews.title: PT Toba Sejahtera's Ownership in TOBA Decreased Slightly After Transaction
tickerNews.content: TOBA: The ownership of PT Toba Sejahtera in TBS Energi Utama decreased by 2.5 million (0.03%) shares, based on KSEI data as of July 21, 2025. The value of this transaction is unknown. This transaction caused PT Toba Sejahtera's ownership portion in TOBA to drop from 8.16% to 8.13%.

tickerNews.title: Djarum Group entity PT Dwimuria Investama Andalan Increases Stake in SSIA
tickerNews.content: SSIA: The ownership of Djarum group entity, PT Dwimuria Investama Andalan, in Surya Semesta Internusa increased by approximately 4.1 million (0.08%) shares, based on KSEI data as of July 21, 2025. The value of this transaction is unknown. This transaction caused PT Dwimuria Investama Andalan's ownership portion in SSIA to rise from 6.66% to 6.74%.

tickerNews.title: BNLI Net Profit rises 19% YoY in 2Q25, NII growth stagnates due to NIM contraction despite loan growth
tickerNews.content: BNLI: Bank Permata recorded a net profit of 856 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (+19% YoY, +8.5% QoQ), bringing the net profit for 1H25 to 1.6 trillion rupiah (+7.6% YoY). The increase in net profit was driven by Non-Interest Income (Non-II) which rose +17% YoY during 1H25. Meanwhile, Net Interest Income (NII) only grew +1% YoY during 1H25, accompanying a decrease in Net Interest Margin (NIM) to 4.11% (vs. 1H24: 4.34%) although loans and financing grew +7.4% YoY (vs. 1H24: +10.2% YoY). In terms of asset quality, gross NPL decreased to 2.06% (vs. 1H24: 2.41%), with provision expenses decreasing -24% YoY in 2Q25 although they still grew +2.5% YoY during 1H25.

tickerNews.title: ADHI Net Profit in 2Q25 reaches IDR 7.2 Billion, 1H25 Net Profit down 45% YoY
tickerNews.content: ADHI: Adhi Karya recorded a net profit of 7.2 billion rupiah in 2Q25 (vs. 2Q24: 3.6 billion rupiah, 1Q25: 317 million rupiah). This result brought the net profit for 1H25 to 7.5 billion rupiah (-45% YoY). Revenue in 2Q25 decreased year-on-year to 2.1 trillion rupiah (-30% YoY, +26% QoQ), resulting in 1H25 revenue decreasing -33% YoY to 3.8 trillion rupiah.
